title: Rhyme Scheme Quiz
description: Test your ability to identify and understand the rhyme patterns that give poetry its musical quality

questions.question: What is a 'rhyme scheme'?
options: A plan to make words rhyme
The pattern of end rhymes in a poem, represented by letters like ABAB

questions.question: In the rhyme scheme ABAB, which lines rhyme with each other?
What rhyme scheme do the quatrains of a Shakespearean sonnet follow?
What is 'perfect rhyme' (also called exact rhyme or true rhyme)?
options: Words that are spelled the same
Words where the final stressed vowel and all following sounds are identical, like 'cat' and 'hat'
Any words that sound somewhat similar
Words that have the same number of syllables

questions.question: What is 'slant rhyme' (also called near rhyme or half rhyme)?
options: Words that rhyme in another language
Words with similar but not identical sounds, like 'shape' and 'keep'
Words that rhyme only when whispered

questions.question: What is 'internal rhyme'?
options: A rhyme between the title and the last line
A rhyme that occurs within a single line of poetry, rather than at the end of lines
A hidden rhyme the reader must discover
A rhyme that occurs only in the poet's mind

questions.question: What rhyme scheme does a limerick follow?
What is 'eye rhyme'?
options: A rhyme you can only see on paper
A rhyme between two visual poems
Words that look like they should rhyme based on spelling but do not sound alike, such as 'love' and 'move'

questions.question: The rhyme scheme ABBA is also known as:
What rhyme scheme does a Petrarchan sonnet's octave (first 8 lines) typically follow?
What is 'masculine rhyme'?
options: A rhyme on a single stressed syllable at the end of a line, like 'bake' and 'lake'
Rhyme used only by male poets

questions.question: What is 'feminine rhyme'?
options: Rhyme used only by female poets
A rhyme involving two or more syllables, where the stress falls on the first, like 'living' and 'giving'

questions.question: The interlocking rhyme scheme ABA BCB CDC is characteristic of which poetic form?
options: Terza rima (used by Dante in the Divine Comedy)

questions.question: What is 'free verse' in terms of rhyme scheme?
options: Poetry that uses only perfect rhymes
Poetry that does not follow any regular rhyme scheme or meter
Poetry that is free to download
